info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 10 at 7:58PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...AN AREA OF HEAVY RAIN WITH INTENSE LIGHTNING WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN MECKLENBURG...SOUTH CENTRAL GASTON AND YORK COUNTIES UNTIL 830 PM EDT... At 758 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated the leading edge of an area of heavy rain with intense lightning along a line extending from 4 miles south of York to 9 miles north of Lancaster, and moving north at 15 mph. Locations to be impacted include... Rock Hill, York, Gastonia, Southwest Charlotte, Fort Mill, South Gastonia, Tega Cay, Clover, Newport and Lesslie. In addition to intense lightning, very heavy rainfall rates up to 2 inches per hour will be possible in these areas.
info.instruction: The combination of gusty winds and saturated soil conditions will cause scattered trees and power lines to fall. Seek shelter inside an interior room. Torrential rainfall may flood areas with poor drainage, such as ditches and underpasses. Avoid these areas and do not cross flooded roads. Water levels of small streams may also rise rapidly. Seek higher ground if threatened by flood waters. Frequent lightning is occurring with these storms. If outdoors, try to get indoors or into a hard topped vehicle. Otherwise, stay away from open areas and isolated high objects such as trees. When indoors, stay away from windows and doors and avoid using wired electronic devices. Do not take a shower or bath. Try to unplug unnecessary appliances before the storms approach.
